alert.note: Alert for Hocking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 3:19PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF HOCKING COUNTY THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 318 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Hocking Hills State Park, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Logan, Nelsonville, Hocking Hills State Park, Hide-A-Way Hills, Starr, Murray City, Gibisonville, Ilesboro, Haydenville, Lake Logan State Park, Enterprise, Union Furnace, Rockbridge, Oreville, Carbon Hill and South Bloomingville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
